title: Ola’s plan to move from escooters to autonomous EVs is ludicrous
content:
After successfully entering the Indian escooter market, in January, Ola Electric started teasing its debut in the electric car segment — quite a bold move for a five-year-old micromobility company. On Saturday, Bhavish Aggarwal, the company’s CEO, made some even bolder statements about Ola’s EV, as reported by Indian outlet News18. Speaking at the company’s manufacturing plant in Tamil Nadu, Aggarwal said that Ola will be entering the autonomous vehicle segment. Specifically, it’s developing autonomous driving features that will debut in its upcoming four-wheeler both for the Indian and the global markets. Here’s a look at what the EV will…

description: Indian escooter company Ola Electric is surprisingly planning to enter the autonomous EV market in just two years.
